title: Advanced Settings
content:
## Advanced Settings Overview

Advanced settings control database mode, performance tuning, logging, and developer options. Most users should leave these at default values.

## Accessing Advanced Settings

1. Click **Settings** gear icon ⚙️
2. Select the **Advanced** tab

## Database Mode

**Current Mode Display:**
- Shows **Standalone (SQLite)** or **Enterprise (SQL Server)**
- Read-only field (grayed out)
- Cannot be changed after initial setup

**Why can't I change it?**
- Database structure differs between modes
- Changing modes requires data migration
- Risk of data loss if done incorrectly

**Need to migrate?**
- Contact your IT administrator
- Follow migration procedures in deployment guide
- Backup all data before migrating

## Performance Options

**Enable connection pooling**
- ☑ Recommended: Keep enabled
- Reuses network connections for better performance
- Reduces connection overhead
- Faster command execution

**When to disable:**
- Only if experiencing connection issues
- Some firewalls may interfere
- Usually safe to keep enabled

**Cache projector status**
- ☑ Recommended: Keep enabled
- Reduces network traffic
- Shows last-known status when offline
- Refreshes every 5 seconds (configurable in Connection settings)

**When to disable:**
- If you need real-time status always
- If status seems "stuck" or outdated
- Troubleshooting connection issues

## Logging Settings

**Log Level options:**

**Debug**
- Maximum detail
- Every operation logged
- Very large log files (MB per day)
- Only use when troubleshooting

**Info** (Recommended)
- Normal operational logs
- Key events logged
- Moderate file size
- Good balance of detail vs. size

**Warning**
- Only warnings and errors
- Minimal logging
- Small log files
- May miss useful troubleshooting info

**Error**
- Only errors logged
- Very minimal logging
- Smallest log files
- Not recommended for normal use

**Open Log Folder button:**
- Opens `%APPDATA%\ProjectorControl\logs\`
- View log files for troubleshooting
- Share logs with IT support
- Each log file named with date: `projector_control_2026-02-13.log`

## Developer Options

**Enable debug mode**
- ☐ Default: Disabled
- Extra diagnostic information
- Very large log files (10x normal size)
- Performance impact

**When to enable:**
- Only when requested by support
- When debugging specific issues
- When developing custom integrations

**When to disable:**
- Normal daily use
- After troubleshooting complete
- If logs fill disk space

**⚠ Warning:**
Debug mode generates very large log files that can quickly consume disk space. Only enable when actively troubleshooting, and disable when done.

## Best Practices

1. **Leave performance options enabled**
   - Connection pooling improves speed
   - Status caching reduces network load
   - Only disable if troubleshooting

2. **Use Info log level normally**
   - Good balance of detail
   - Manageable file sizes
   - Switch to Debug only when needed

3. **Enable Debug temporarily**
   - When experiencing issues
   - Reproduce the problem with Debug enabled
   - Send logs to support
   - Switch back to Info when done

4. **Clean old log files**
   - Open log folder periodically
   - Delete logs older than 30 days
   - Keep recent logs for reference

> **Tip:** If experiencing issues, set Log Level to "Debug", reproduce the problem, then send the log files to your IT administrator or support.
